text: (i) Effective date—(1) In general. This

text: (a) Method of accounting. (1) Section
label: BODY

text: 818(a)(1) provides the general rule that
label: BODY

text: all computations entering into the de-
label: BODY

text: termination of taxes imposed by part I,
label: BODY

text: subchapter L, chapter 1 of the Code,
label: BODY

text: shall be made under an accrual method
label: BODY

text: of accounting. Thus, the over-all meth-
label: BODY

text: od of accounting for life insurance
label: BODY

text: companies shall be the accrual method.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: the term ‘‘accrual method’’ shall have
label: BODY

text: the same meaning and application in
label: BODY

text: section 818 as it does under section 446
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: accounting) and the regulations there-
label: BODY

text: (2) Section 818(a)(2) provides that, to
label: BODY

text: the extent permitted under this sec-
label: BODY

text: tion, a life insurance company’s meth-
label: BODY

text: od of accounting may be a combination
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code

text: of 1954, other than the cash receipts

text: use by a life insurance company of the
label: BODY

text: od either separately or in combination

text: with a permissible method of account-
label: BODY

text: ing. The term ‘‘method of accounting’’
label: BODY

text: includes not only the over-all method
label: BODY

text: of accounting of the taxpayer but also
label: BODY

text: the accounting treatment of any item.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of section 818(a)(2), a life
label: BODY

text: insurance company may elect to com-
label: BODY

text: pute its taxable income under an over-
label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

text: (2) The application of subparagraph
label: BODY

text: (1) of this paragraph may be illustrated
label: BODY

text: by the following examples:
label: BODY

text: Example 1. Assume that during the taxable
label: BODY

text: year 1960, M, a life insurance company, de-
label: BODY

text: termines that the amount of its life insur-
label: BODY

text: ance reserves held with respect to a par-
label: BODY

text: ticular block of contracts is understated on
label: BODY

text: the present basis being used in valuing such
label: BODY

text: liability and that such liability can be more
label: BODY

text: accurately reflected by changing from the
label: BODY

text: present basis to a particular new basis. As-
label: BODY

text: sume that M uses such new basis in com-
label: BODY

text: puting its reserves under such contracts at
label: BODY

text: the end of the taxable year 1960. Under the
label: BODY

text: provisions of section 818(a) and subparagraph
label: BODY

text: (1) of this paragraph, the change in basis for
label: BODY

text: purposes of sections 806(b) and 810(d) occurs
label: BODY

text: during the taxable year 1960, the year in
label: BODY

text: which all the events have occurred which de-
label: BODY

text: termine the change in basis and the amount
label: BODY

text: of any increase (or decrease) attributable to
label: BODY

text: such change can be determined with reason-
label: BODY

text: able accuracy. Such change shall be treated
label: BODY

text: as having occurred during the taxable year
label: BODY

text: 1960 whether M determines that its liability
label: BODY

text: under such contracts was understated for the
label: BODY

text: first time during 1960, or that its liability
label: BODY

text: under such contracts has, in fact, been un-
label: BODY

text: derstated for a number of prior years.
label: BODY

text: Example 2. Assume the facts are the same
label: BODY

text: as in example 1, except that during the tax-
label: BODY

text: able year 1960 the insurance department of
label: BODY

text: State X issues a ruling, pursuant to author-
label: BODY

text: ity conferred by statute, requiring M to use
label: BODY

text: the particular new basis which more accu-
label: BODY

text: rately reflects its liability with respect to
label: BODY

text: such contracts and that as a result of such
label: BODY

text: ruling, M uses the new basis in computing its
label: BODY

text: reserves under such contracts for the taxable
label: BODY

text: years 1958, 1959, and 1960. Under the provi-
label: BODY

text: sions of section 818(a) and subparagraph (1)
label: BODY

text: of this paragraph, the change in basis for
label: BODY

text: purposes of sections 806(b) and 810(d) occurs
label: BODY

text: during the taxable year 1960, the year in
label: BODY

text: which all the events have occurred which de-
label: BODY

text: termine that a change in basis should be

label: BODY

text: Amortization of premium and
label: BODY

text: accrual of discount.
label: BODY

text: (a) In general. Section 818(b) provides
label: BODY

text: that the appropriate items of income,
label: BODY

text: deductions,
label: BODY

text: and
label: BODY

text: adjustments
label: BODY

text: under
label: BODY

text: part I, subchapter L, chapter 1 of the
label: BODY

text: Code, shall be adjusted to reflect the
label: BODY

text: appropriate amortization of premium
label: BODY

text: and the appropriate accrual of discount
label: BODY

text: on bonds, notes, debentures, or other
label: BODY

text: evidences of indebtedness held by a life
label: BODY

text: insurance company. Such adjustments
label: BODY

text: are limited to the amount of appro-
label: BODY

text: priate amortization or accrual attrib-
label: BODY

text: utable to the taxable year with respect
label: BODY

text: to such securities which are not in de-
label: BODY

text: fault as to principal or interest and
label: BODY

text: which are amply secured. The question
label: BODY

text: of ample security will be resolved ac-
label: BODY

text: cording to the rules laid down from
label: BODY

text: time to time by the National Associa-
label: BODY

text: tion of Insurance Commissioners. The
label: BODY

text: adjustment for amortization of pre-
label: BODY

text: mium decreases the gross investment
label: BODY

text: income, the exclusion and reduction for
label: BODY

text: wholly tax-exempt interest, the exclu-
label: BODY

text: sion and deduction for partially tax-ex-
label: BODY

text: empt interest, and the basis or ad-
label: BODY

text: justed basis of such securities. The ad-
label: BODY

text: justment for accrual of discount in-
label: BODY

text: creases the gross investment income,
label: BODY

text: the exclusion and reduction for wholly
label: BODY

text: tax-exempt interest, the exclusion and
label: BODY

text: deduction for partially tax-exempt in-
label: BODY

text: terest, and the basis or adjusted basis
label: BODY

text: of such securities. However, for taxable
label: BODY

text: years beginning after May 31, 1960, only
label: BODY

text: the accrual of discount relating to
label: BODY

text: issue discount will increase the exclu-
label: BODY

text: sion and reduction for wholly tax-ex-
label: BODY

text: empt interest. See section 103.
label: BODY

text: (b) Acquisitions before January 1, 1958.
label: BODY

text: (1) In the case of any such security ac-
label: BODY

text: quired before January 1, 1958, the pre-
label: BODY

text: mium is the excess of its acquisition
label: BODY

text: value over its maturity value and the
label: BODY

text: discount is the excess of its maturity
label: BODY

text: value over its acquisition value. The
label: BODY

text: acquisition value of any such security
label: BODY

text: is its cost (including buying commis-
label: BODY

text: sions or brokerage but excluding any
label: BODY

text: amounts paid for accrued interest) if
label: BODY

text: purchased for cash, or if not purchased
label: BODY

text: for cash, its then fair market value.
label: BODY

text: The maturity value of any such secu-
label: BODY

text: rity is the amount payable thereunder
label: BODY

text: either at the maturity date or an ear-
label: BODY

text: lier call date. The earlier call date of
label: BODY

text: any such security may be the earliest
label: BODY

text: interest payment date if it is callable
label: BODY

text: or payable at such date, the earliest
label: BODY

text: date at which it is callable at par, or
label: BODY

text: such other call or payment date, prior
label: BODY

text: to maturity, specified in the security
label: BODY

text: as may be selected by the life insur-
label: BODY

text: ance company. A life insurance com-
label: BODY

text: pany which adjusts amortization of
label: BODY

text: premium or accrual of discount with
label: BODY

text: reference to a particular call or pay-
label: BODY

text: ment date must make the adjustments
label: BODY

text: with reference to the value on such
label: BODY

text: date and may not, after selecting such
label: BODY

text: date, use a different call or payment
label: BODY

text: date, or value, in the calculation of
label: BODY

text: such amortization or discount with re-
label: BODY

text: spect to such security unless the secu-
label: BODY

text: rity was not in fact called or paid on
label: BODY

text: such selected date.
label: BODY

text: (2) The adjustments for amortization
label: BODY

text: of premium and accrual of discount
label: BODY

text: will be determined:
label: BODY

text: (i) According to the method regularly
label: BODY

text: employed by the company, if such
label: BODY

text: method is reasonable, or
label: BODY

text: (ii) According to the method pre-
label: BODY

text: scribed by this section.
label: BODY

text: A method of amortization of premium
label: BODY

text: or accrual of discount will be deemed
label: BODY

text: ‘‘regularly employed’’ by a life insur-
label: BODY

text: ance company if the method was con-
label: BODY

text: sistently followed in prior taxable
label: BODY

text: years, or if, in the case of a company
label: BODY

text: which has never before made such ad-
label: BODY

text: justments, the company initiates in
label: BODY

text: the first taxable year for which the ad-
label: BODY

text: justments are made a reasonable meth-
label: BODY

text: od of amortization of premium or ac-
label: BODY

text: crual of discount and consistently fol-
label: BODY

text: lows such method thereafter. Ordi-
label: BODY

text: narily, a company regularly employs a
label: BODY

text: method in accordance with the statute
label: BODY

text: of some State, Territory, or the Dis-
label: BODY

text: trict of Columbia, in which it operates.
label: BODY

text: (3) The method of amortization and
label: BODY

text: accrual prescribed by this section is as
label: BODY

text: follows:
label: BODY

text: (i) The premium (or discount) shall
label: BODY

text: be determined in accordance with this
label: BODY

text: section; and
label: BODY

text: (ii) The appropriate amortization of
label: BODY

text: premium (or accrual of discount) at-
label: BODY

text: tributable to the taxable year shall be
label: BODY

text: an amount which bears the same ratio
label: BODY
